cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 mi (100 km) south of Camaguey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest along the south-central Cuban coast, expected to enter the Gulf of Mexico tonight and curve northwest toward the central-northwest Gulf, aiming for the Louisiana-Texas border area.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-west Louisiana coast near Cameron / Texas-Louisiana border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for the Florida Keys from Craig Key to Key West (not including Louisiana).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warnings for Little Cayman, Cayman Brac, much of Cuba and the Dry Tortugas.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and northwest Gulf Coast from the upper Texas coast across Louisiana to Mississippi/Alabama.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) are increasingly likely; hurricane-force gusts are possible if Laura strengthens and makes landfall near the port area.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of several feet is possible along the lower Mississippi River and adjacent bays if the center makes landfall west of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with isolated 15-inch amounts forecast near the Louisiana coast, producing flash and urban flooding potential at the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in outer rainbands; rough seas and dangerous surf will disrupt maritime operations well before landfall.
